cards.name: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire
cards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
cards.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."

cards.name: Deja Vu
cards.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
cards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

cards.name: Demolition Run
cards.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
cards.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

cards.name: Stimhack
cards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[Credits], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[Credits] not spent.

cards.name: Cyberfeeder
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
cards.flavor: I feel almost naked without it.

cards.name: Grimoire
cards.text: +2[Memory Units] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard

cards.name: Corroder
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru

cards.name: Datasucker
cards.text: Whenever you make a succesful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

cards.name: Djinn
cards.text: Djinn can host up to 3[Memory Units] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [Click], 1[Credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

cards.name: Medium
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D when you access cards from R&D.
cards.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.

cards.name: Mimic
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
cards.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

cards.name: Parasite
cards.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.

cards.name: Wyrm
cards.text: 3[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength. 1[Credit]: Ice has -1 strength. 1[Credit]: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: Fire and ichor...

cards.name: Yog.0
cards.text: 0[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!

cards.name: Ice Carver
cards.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
cards.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

cards.name: Wyldside
cards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [Click].
cards.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

cards.name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[Credits].
cards.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."

cards.name: Account Siphon
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lost up to 5[Credits], then you gain 2[Credits] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.

cards.name: Inside Job
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Som real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket..."

cards.name: Forged Activation Orders
cards.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
cards.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

cards.name: Inside Job
cards.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
cards.flavor: "Hey, listen. I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

cards.name: Special Order
cards.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later...

cards.name: Lemuria Codecracker
cards.text: [Click], 1[Credit]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
cards.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago

cards.name: Desperado
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Gain 1[Credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.

cards.name: Aurora
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.

cards.name: Femme Fatale
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may spend 1[Credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

cards.name: Ninja
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
cards.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

cards.name: Sneakdoor Beta
cards.text: [Click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
cards.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

cards.name: Bank Job
cards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

cards.name: Crash Space
cards.text: 2[Recurring Credits] Use these credits to pay for removing tags. [Trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
cards.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yearh, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.

cards.name: Data Dealer
cards.text: Forfeit an agenda, [Click]: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

cards.name: Decoy
cards.text: [Trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
cards.flavor: "I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank." "What makes you say that, D?" "The curlers."

cards.name: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker
cards.text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
cards.flavor: "Are you listening?"

cards.name: Diesel
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.flavor: Diesel give you flames.

cards.name: Modded
cards.text: Install a program or a piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
cards.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

cards.name: The Maker's Eye
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
cards.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see beyond the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

cards.name: Tinkering
cards.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of turn.
cards.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."

cards.name: Akamatsu Mem Chip
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit]
cards.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.

cards.name: Rabbit Hole
cards.text:
+1[Link]
When Rabbit hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
cards.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

cards.name: The Personal Touch
cards.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
cards.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there...

cards.name: The Toolbox
cards.text: +2[Memory Units] +2[Link] 2[Recurring Credits] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.

cards.name: Battering Ram
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

cards.name: Gordian Blade
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

cards.name: Magnum Opus
cards.text: [Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
cards.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the wold had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

cards.name: Net Shield
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
cards.flavor: Sucks energy like a Martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused.

cards.name: Pipeline
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

cards.name: Aesop's Pawnshop
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[Credits].
cards.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as werll.

cards.name: Sacrificial Construct
cards.text: [Trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
cards.flavor: The life expectency of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.

cards.name: Infiltration
cards.text: Gain 2[Credits] or expose 1 card.
cards.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy

cards.name: Sure Gamble
cards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

cards.name: Crypsis
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break ice subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength. [Click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.

cards.name: Access to Globalsec
cards.text: +1[Link]
cards.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay...

cards.name: Armitage Codebusting
cards.text: Place 12[Credits] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it. [Click]: Take 2[Credits] from Armitage Codebusting.
cards.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

cards.name: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future
cards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[Credit].
cards.flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.

cards.name: Accelerated Beta Test
cards.text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.

cards.name: Adonis Campaign
cards.text:
Place 12[Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.

cards.name: Aggressive Secretary
cards.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[Credits] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

cards.name: Archived Memories
cards.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.flavor: "Do you think they...feel it?"

cards.name: Biotic Labor
cards.text: Gain [Click][Click].
cards.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

cards.name: Shipment from MirrorMorph
cards.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (sending no clicks but paying all install costs).
cards.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

cards.name: Heimdall 1.0
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

cards.name: Ichi 1.0
cards.text: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace1- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
cards.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

cards.name: Viktor 1.0
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?

cards.name: Rototurret
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: Whrrrrr!

cards.name: Corporate Troubleshooter
cards.text: X[Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: I solve problems.

cards.name: Experiential Data
cards.text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
cards.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only going to make things worse, he thought.

cards.name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
cards.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

cards.name: Nisei MK II
cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.

cards.name: Project Junebug
cards.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

cards.name: Snare!
cards.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[Credits] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

cards.name: Zaibatsu Loyalty
cards.text: If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty. 1[Credit] or [Trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.

cards.name: Neural EMP
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
cards.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.

cards.name: Precognition
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
cards.flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything, and nothing.

cards.name: Cell Portal
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
cards.flavor: "Where does it go?"

cards.name: Chum
cards.text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
cards.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

cards.name: Data Mine
cards.text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
cards.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n

cards.name: Neural Katana
cards.text: [Subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
cards.flavor: Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i. //Samurai included.

cards.name: Wall of Thorns
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large numer of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.

cards.name: Akitaro Watanabe
cards.text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
cards.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.

cards.name: NBN: Making News
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
cards.flavor: Someone is Always Watching

cards.name: AstroScript Pilot Program
cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

cards.name: Breaking News
cards.text: When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags. When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.

cards.name: Anonymous Tip
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

cards.name: Closed Accounts
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.

cards.name: Psychographics
cards.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

cards.name: SEA Source
cards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace3- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

cards.name: Ghost Branch
cards.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

cards.name: Data Raven
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted Power Counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3- If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.

cards.name: Matrix Analyzer
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[Credit] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. [Subroutine] Trace2- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.

cards.name: Tollbooth
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Ever heard of a catch-22?" "Remind me to forget it."

cards.name: Red Herrings
cards.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[Credits] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

cards.name: SanSan City Grid
cards.text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.flavor: "I hear the coast is nice this time of year." "If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."

cards.name: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
cards.text: Gain 1[Credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
cards.flavor: Moving Upwards.

cards.name: Hostile Takeover
cards.text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

cards.name: Posted Bounty
cards.text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil or the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."

cards.name: Security Subcontract
cards.text: [Click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[Credits].
cards.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." -Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security

cards.name: Aggressive Negotiation
cards.text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms quite favorable."

cards.name: Beanstalk Royalties
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone...for a small fee.

cards.name: Scorched Earth
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
cards.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries..."

cards.name: Shipment from Kaguya
cards.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.flavor: "And then there's these two crates. No eID." "Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw 'em."

cards.name: Archer
cards.text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

cards.name: Hadrian's Wall
cards.text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. His constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

cards.name: Ice Wall
cards.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

cards.name: Shadow
cards.text: Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it. [Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace3- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

cards.name: Research Station
cards.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
cards.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."

cards.name: Priority Requisition
cards.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
cards.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

cards.name: Private Security Force
cards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
cards.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

cards.name: Melange Mining Corp.
cards.text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7[Credits].
cards.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Tak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone

cards.name: PAD Campaign
cards.text: Gain 1[Credit] when your turn begins.
cards.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.

cards.name: Hedge Fund
cards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

cards.name: Enigma
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?" "I...don't remember."

cards.name: Hunter
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.flavor: .//run/hunter-tr/return=true client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y 3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR

cards.name: Wall of Static
cards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
